intro: Cullen cinereum, commonly known as the silverleaf cullen, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features delicate, silver-gray leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, pale blue or purple flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cullen cinereum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
